events.name: Google X DSSG
events.description: For the March meetup, we are very happy and pleased to have speakers from Google to share more on their work in data science and related fields. Please note of our attendance policy ( https://www.meetup.com/DataScience-SG-Singapore/events/228169542/ ). Attendees are REQUIRED to RSVP to the event to be allowed into the venue. People who are neither in the "going" nor "wait" lists will be turned away. Please be considerate and update your RSVP if you are not able to make it. Proposed Schedule & Synopsis - 1845 - 1900: Networking - 1900 - 2030: Speaker: Allen DayDesignation: Developer Advocate, Google Cloud Title: Blockchain Analytics on Real-time DatastreamsSynopsis: Blockchains provide a solution for communication and coordination amongst peers in low-trust environments. Use cases are emerging in the financial services, supply chain, media, and other sectors. While blockchains provide transactional and durability features for data capture and storage, they’re not easy to use for extracting specific or aggregate insights about data stored on-chain. In this presentation, we demonstrate how Google Cloud can be used to:perform a real-time extraction of data from a blockchain databasefurther refine and distribute the data with PubSub, graph database JanusGraph on BigTable, and OLAP database BigQueryderive insights from the extracted data with DataStudio and DataLab. Speaker: Sara RobinsonDesignation: Developer Advocate, Google Cloud Title: Text analysis: from pre-trained APIs to custom modelsSynopsis: Most applications deal with text data in some form: from chat messages to product reviews to comments and more. Making sense of large amounts of text data manually is difficult and time consuming. Luckily, advances in natural language processing (NLP) have given us a variety of tools to help analyze text. Whether you’re new to ML or you’ve already built your own custom model, by the end of this talk you’ll know how to get started adding NLP to your own application. I’ll begin by introducing the Cloud Natural Language API, which lets you utilize a pre-trained model to get insights from your text with a single API call. Then I’ll discuss how to build a custom model trained on your own data using TensorFlow and Cloud ML Engine, with lots of live demos along the way. Name: Markku LepistoDesignation: Solutions Architect, Google Cloud Title: Google Cloud AutoMLSynopsis: Join this session to see AutoML Vision in action, to easily and quickly create a custom Vision API model. In this live demo, Markku will show an example of creating training data sets, training a model with AutoML, and using it for inference. The use case here is to see if we can detect which 'rubber stamp' was used to 'chop' scanned documents' pages. RSVP Time Start: 13 March 2018, Wednesday, 12:00pm End: 25 March 2018, Sunday, 12:00 PM
events.location: Google Singapore, Mapletree Business City II, 70 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-01

events.name: Ask Me Anything - by Hope Liu Eximchain CEO: Power, Future Women in Blockchain
events.description: [Please register through this link: http://bit.ly/BlockchainLadiesAsia-27Mar2018] Ethereum Singapore x Blockchain Ladies Asia "Ask Me Anything (AMA) by Hope Liu, CEO of Eximchain: Power, Future Women in Blockchain" Our AMA session will be led by Hope Liu, CEO of Eximchain, who's featured on Forbes as one of the "Five Female Rock Stars Leading the Crypto Scene in 2018" (https://www.forbes.com/sites/montymunford/2018/02/27/five-female-rock-stars-leading-the-crypto-scene-in-2018/#593a081f5d13). The tech industry is well-known to be male-dominated and the digital currency space as a subset has shown itself to be the same, with some studies and research even showing that space might be more male-dominated than the general technology industry. In recent times, however, the crypto space is seeing encouraging signs in terms of gender diversity – female speakers are becoming more visible and the number of female attendees has increased significantly. Hope is one of the female leaders on the frontier of using blockchain technology to create better supply chain infrastructure. She will share her experience and personal story in leading a global team and managing a B2B blockchain enterprise solutions company since 2015 as a female CEO/Co-Founder in this male-dominated industry. ### Program ### 6:30 - 7:00 Registration7:00 - 8:00 AMA session: Power, Future Women in Blockchain8:00 - 8:30 Networking ### Speaker ### Hope Liu, CEO of Eximchain Hope is a veteran in the supply chain space. She handled cross-border transactions at UBS Asia for 6.5 years. She is the Lab Lead of the North America Blockchain Association and has been working on Eximchain from the MIT Media Lab since 2015. She has a B.A. from Peking University and MBA from MIT. Follow her on LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/in/hope-liu-9ab4a2101/) and Twitter (https://twitter.com/hopeEximchain). About Eximchain Eximchain enables businesses to connect, transact, and share information more efficiently and securely through our blockchain utility infrastructure. Using Eximchain blockchain technology, enterprises can eliminate traditional supply chain barriers and integrates actors big and small into an efficient, transparent, and secure global network. This event is co-organized by Blockchain Ladies Asia (http://www.blockchainladies.asia/) and Ethereum Singapore (https://www.meetup.com/Ethereum-Singapore/) with Digix Global (https://digix.global), and sponsored by Eximchain (https://www.eximchain.com/) and The Great Room (http://thegreatroomoffices.com/). The venue is The Great Room, One George Street #10-01, 049145. Do join us for a night of sharing of each other’s experiences! Please register here through this link: http://bit.ly/BlockchainLadiesAsia-27Mar2018
events.location: The Great Room, One George Street #10-01, Singapore 049145

events.name: iOS Dev Scout March 2018 Meetup
events.description: Venue: Rakuten Viki32-01, Capita Green, 138 Market Street,[masked] Speakers: • Kenneth Poon - Technical Lead (iOS) at PropertyGuru• Thongchai (Luke) - Software Engineer - iOS at Rakuten Viki Agenda: • 6:30pm: Food and refreshments, say hello to other iOS devs• 7:15pm: XCUITest + Cucumberish: Executing BDD feature files in Xcode - by Kenneth• 7:45pm: Writing High-Performance Swift Code - by Luke• 8:15pm: Show & Tell, quiz with collectibles to be won! About the Topics: • XCUITest + Cucumberish: Executing BDD feature files in XcodeThis is a follow up on a talk Kenneth gave back in 2016 (XCUITest + Gherkins). With the basics of XCUITest out of the way, he will introduce the Cucumberish library that helps to improve your existing XCUITest suite.Cucumberish segment will interest you if- you want to know how "Given Then When" Behavioural Driven Tests can help your iOS Tests- you are interested in executing "Given Then When" BDD Feature files in Xcode- you are not convinced with external cross platform testing tool like Appium and Calabash (because you want to write your tests using Swift)- you want to bring this learning back to work. Feel free to ask more questions during QnA • Writing High-Performance Swift CodeThongchai (Luke) will be sharing about dimensions of performance for Swift language, starting from the basics of allocation, reference counting, and method dispatch. Then he will share stories and ways the compiler can optimise our code and how we can take advantage of it.Finally, he will use Hopper disassembler to inspect how the compiler modifies our code. ----------iOS Conf SG 2017: iOS Conf SG is South East Asia's only annual iOS Conference organised by iOS Dev Scout. Last year's sold-out conference of 300 attendees was held on the 19th and 20th of October with overseas speakers from Facebook, Google, LinkedIn, Instagram, PayPal, PlanGrid, Raywenderlich, Realm, SEA Group, ex-Apple, ex-Twitter and other tech companies to share their technical expertise and experiences. Locally, we’ve speakers from Carousell, Garena, SP Group etc. For more information, visit our iOS Dev Scout Group and iOS Conf SG Page: iOS Conf SG Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/iosconfsg/iOS Conf SG 2017 Videos: https://engineers.sg/conference/iosconfsg-2017iOS Dev Scout Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/iosdevscout/ ----------Sponsors:• Special Thanks to Rakuten Viki for sponsoring the venue, food and drinks! • Special Thanks to Engineers SG (https://twitter.com/engineersftw) for the video recording and coverage!
events.location: Rakuten Viki, Capita Green, 138 Market Street, #32-01, Singapore 048946

Carlos Souza is an author at Pluralsight with a passion for open-source. events.name: March 2018 Meetup - Open House @ Shopee
events.description: This month, Shopee Singapore would like to invite the local Python community to an open house event at the Shopee Cafeteria. We will feature a panel discussion with engineers from different teams at Shopee (data science, data engineering, regional operations). Each of them will give a short talk about how they use Python (with code examples) and the audience is encouraged to post questions so that an engaging panel discussion ensues. The topics aren't set in stone, but to give you an idea of how Shopee uses Python, here are some of the topics that could be covered: REGIONAL OPERATIONS======================== * Using Python Pandas packages to detect duplicated listings on the platform * Using Python to generate reports for different countries to facilitate their daily work DATA ENGINEERING======================== * Data Visualization with Python and Apache Superset * What role does Python play in Superset * Facts & Figures: Dashboards at Shopee (with some live data) DATA SCIENCE=============== Showcase of some Python packages heavily used in the area of data science, such as * Virtualenv * Jupyter * Pandas
events.location: Shopee Office, 2 Science Park Drive #03-01, Tower A, Ascent Singapore

events.name: From information to verification age in blockchain (by Eventum)
events.description:
Data is the gold of the 21st century, and modern companies need access to real-time information in a cost-effective, fast, secure and reliable way. The problem is that real-world data feeds (APIs) can cost thousands of dollars, can be unreliable, or nonexistent altogether, while more than 2 billion people with smartphones have access to real-time events and information around them, but no way of monetizing it.
We are honoured to host Eventum, a platform for decentralized real-world data feeds, solving multi-billion dollar problems, such as fake news detection, real-time content moderation, eSports data streams, real-time feedback for AI algorithms and more.
Their technology is based on the wisdom of the crowd principle, blockchain as a court system and a decentralized network of data reporting and validation nodes which can process data in real-time.

Registration and networking will start from 1900 onwards.This is followed by an introduction on Eventum by its CEO, Martin Mikeln and QnA.Light Refreshments would be provided.Join us for an evening filled with fun, networking and learning.See you there!
events.location: MOX, Katong Point 451 Joo Chiat Rd Singapore, Singapore null

events.name: SharePoint/Office365 March 2018 - Microsoft Teams Development
events.description: Get a free Office Servers T Shirt !! Senthamil (MVP) will be talking about how to develop for Microsoft Teams. Agenda:1. Fundamentals of Microsoft Teams2. Development Prerequisites3. How to create Tabs in teams4. Demo / code walk through This session will be step by step approach on how to create tabs on Teams. If you want to try it during the session please bring the Laptop with you. Below are the Prerequisites--------------------------------------You must have an Office 365 tenant and Windows Azure subscription.You must turn on Microsoft Teams for your organization.Follow the instructions in this link https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/setupYou must have Microsoft Teams installed.Download it at this link https://teams.microsoft.com/downloads.You must have Visual Studio 2017 with the ASP.NET and web application components installed.

events.name: Introduction to Web Design (R2)
events.description:
This is a free introductory course to those who are exploring stepping into the web design industry, picking up web design skills, or creating their own websites.

Course Criteria
If you are…


an aspiring web designer or web developer


interested to join the web industry


a business owner looking to create your own budget website


looking to sell things online through your own website


exploring web design courses to sign up for, but not sure if you are ready for it?



Course Outline


What is a website? What is web design?


What makes up a website? What are the basic elements in a web template?


What makes up a website? What goes on behind the scenes?


How will UI, UX, SEO and Mobile affect web design?


What are the various ways of creating a website and the costs/resources involved?



Course Format
Each class has a maximum of 10 people, and group discussions are frequently held throughout the session. This course is an introductory session, so no laptops are required, although recommended.

Course Fee
This is meant to be a free introductory session. At no point before, during or after this course will we collect a fee for your participation in this course. Light snacks and drinks will be provided.

events.name: Wake up with Landor - Tech & Gender
events.description:
Join Google, Facebook, P&G and Landor for a lively discussion around the two biggest forces that will redefine our future – tech and gender.
Companies need to develop their AI brand strategy, quickly. Marketers who do not embrace technology will only face increased challenges as the market, and its offerings, rapidly evolve.
We will uncover the existing and potential tensions that could arise, particularly in the context of evolving gender roles and (in)equality. Be refreshed with new perspectives. Engage with industry experts. Equip yourself with relevant insights to sharpen your business strategy.
Looking forward to seeing you there!
